intro: Peristrophe chinensis, commonly known as Chinese peristrophe, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often arranged in spikes at the tips of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
